content: left-overs by merri purdy materials list any odds and ends of worsted weight fiber size g 4 0mm crochet hook stitches/abbreviations used chain chain double_crochet double_crochet rsc reverse single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch gauge not essential pattern notes  this project is worked in the round  begin each round of double_crochet with a ch3 counts as first double_crochet st of the round  finished coasters are approximately 3 ¾ in diameter magic_ring leaving a short tail wrap your yarn once or twice around the width of two fingers to create a loop i like to use my thumb to hold the loop in place insert hook through center of this loop and pull thread through loop yarn over and pull through loop on hook 1st chain made chain two more for a total of three starting chains the first three chains will count as your first double_crochet here and throughout directions round 1 begin with 12 double_crochet into your magic_ring using the short tail carefully pull the tail so that the ring tightens and there is no hole in the center of your starting round join the round with a slip_stitch to the top of your starting chain round 2 chain 3 counts as your first double_crochet of the round place another double_crochet in same st continue by placing 2dc in each remaining st around slip_stitch to join 24 double_crochet sts round 3 2 double_crochet in first st 1 double_crochet in next st around slip_stitch to join 36 sts ch1 does not count as a st round 4 2sc in first st single_crochet in next two sts around slip_stitch to join 48 single_crochet round 5 rsc in each st around bring loop to back of work join with slip_stitch fasten_off and weave in end ta dah enjoy © merri purdy 02/18/2013 1
